summary: Lifts over a VCF file from one reference build to another.

arguments.summary: Allow INFO and FORMAT in the records that are not found in the header
arguments.name: --ALLOW_MISSING_FIELDS_IN_HEADER

arguments.summary: The liftover chain file. See https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/chain.html for a description of chain files.  See http://hgdownload.soe.ucsc.edu/downloads.html#terms for where to download chain files.
arguments.name: --CHAIN

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Output VCF file will be written on the fly but it won't be sorted and indexed.
arguments.name: --DISABLE_SORT

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: The input VCF/BCF file to be lifted over.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: The minimum percent match required for a variant to be lifted.
arguments.name: --LIFTOVER_MIN_MATCH

arguments.summary: If true, intervals failing due to match below LIFTOVER_MIN_MATCH will be logged as a warning to the console.
arguments.name: --LOG_FAILED_INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The output location for the lifted over VCF/BCF.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: If the REF allele of the lifted site does not match the target genome, that variant is normally rejected. For bi-allelic SNPs, if this is set to true and the ALT allele equals the new REF allele, the REF and ALT alleles will be swapped.  This can rescue some variants; however, do this carefully as some annotations may become invalid, such as any that are alelle-specifc.  See also TAGS_TO_REVERSE and TAGS_TO_DROP.
arguments.name: --RECOVER_SWAPPED_REF_ALT

arguments.summary: The reference sequence (fasta) for the TARGET genome build (i.e., the new one.  The fasta file must have an accompanying sequence dictionary (.dict file).
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: File to which to write rejected records.
arguments.name: --REJECT

arguments.summary: INFO field annotations that should be deleted when swapping reference with variant alleles.
arguments.name: --TAGS_TO_DROP

arguments.summary: INFO field annotations that behave like an Allele Frequency and should be transformed with x->1-x when swapping reference with variant alleles.
arguments.name: --TAGS_TO_REVERSE

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: Warn on missing contig.
arguments.name: --WARN_ON_MISSING_CONTIG

arguments.summary: Write the original alleles for lifted variants to the INFO field.  If the alleles are identical, this attribute will be omitted.
arguments.name: --WRITE_ORIGINAL_ALLELES

arguments.summary: Write the original contig/position for lifted variants to the INFO field.
arguments.name: --WRITE_ORIGINAL_POSITION

description:
Summary

Tool for "lifting over" a VCF from one genome build to another, producing a properly headered, sorted and indexed VCF in one go.

Details

This tool adjusts the coordinates of variants within a VCF file to match a new reference. The output file will be sorted and indexed using the target reference build. To be clear, #REFERENCE_SEQUENCE should be the target reference build (that is, the "new" one). The tool is based on the UCSC LiftOver tool and uses a UCSC chain file to guide its operation.
For each variant, the tool will look for the target coordinate, reverse-complement and left-align the variant if needed, and, in the case that the reference and alternate alleles of a SNP have been swapped in the new genome build, it will adjust the SNP, and correct AF-like INFO fields and the relevant genotypes.

Example

 java -jar picard.jar LiftoverVcf \\
     I=input.vcf \\
     O=lifted_over.vcf \\
     CHAIN=b37tohg38.chain \\
     REJECT=rejected_variants.vcf \\
     R=reference_sequence.fasta

Caveats

Rejected Records

Records may be rejected because they cannot be lifted over or because of sequence incompatibilities between the source and target reference genomes. Rejected records will be emitted to the #REJECT file using the source genome build coordinates. The reason for the rejection will be stated in the FILTER field, and more detail may be placed in the INFO field.

Memory Use

LiftOverVcf sorts the output using a htsjdk.samtools.util.SortingCollection which relies on #MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM to specify how many (vcf) records to hold in memory before "spilling" to disk. The default value is reasonable when sorting SAM files, but not for VCFs as there is no good default due to the dependence on the number of samples and amount of information in the INFO and FORMAT fields. Consider lowering to 100,000 or even less if you have many genotypes.
name: LiftoverVcf
